articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: A French court found all 51 defendants guilty on Thursday in a drugging-and-rape case that horrified the world and transformed the victim, Gisele Pelicot, into a stirring symbol of courage and resilience.
articles.title: Dominique Pelicot jailed for 20 years in landmark French mass rape trial

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: Human Rights Watch said on Thursday that Israel has killed thousands of Palestinians in Gaza by denying them clean water which it says legally amounts to acts of genocide and extermination.
articles.title: Human Rights Watch says Israel's deprivation of water in Gaza is act of genocide

articles.author: Richard Cowan, Bo Erickson, Andy Sullivan, Katharine Jackson
articles.description: The U.S. Congress has two days to avert a partial government shutdown after Republican President-elect Donald Trump rejected a bipartisan deal late on Wednesday and demanded lawmakers also raise the nation's debt ceiling before he takes office next month.
articles.title: US Congress has two days to avert shutdown after Trump rejects spending bill

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's "long hand" will reach the leaders of Yemen's Houthi movement, Defence Minister Israel Katz vowed on Thursday, after unleashing airstrikes on several areas of the Arab country overnight.
articles.title: Israel vows to reach Houthi leaders, as Houthi TV says strikes kill nine

articles.author: Ahmed Eljechtimi, Michel Rose
articles.description: Four French nationals held in Burkina Faso for a year have been released following mediation from Morocco, France and Morocco said on Thursday, resolving a diplomatic row over their detention.
articles.title: Burkina Faso frees four French spies after Moroccan mediation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Romania's ruling leftist Social Democrat Party (PSD) has withdrawn from government coalition talks but will endorse a centre-right minority government in parliament, Prime Minister and PSD leader Marcel Ciolacu said on Thursday.
articles.title: Romanian ruling Social Democrats withdraw from government coalition talks

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Renju Jose
articles.description: People on the Pacific island nation of Vanuatu braced on Thursday for heavy rains and a possible cyclone, two days after a 7.3 magnitude earthquake killed at least 16 people, wrecked buildings and cut power and water supplies.
articles.title: Vanuatu braces for heavy rains two days after deadly quake

articles.author: Gleb Bryanski, Vladimir Soldatkin
articles.description: The Russian economy is showing signs of overheating which is stoking worryingly high inflation, President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday.
articles.title: Putin says Russia's economy is overheating, inflation is worrying

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea said on Thursday its military alliance with Russia is proving "very effective" in deterring the United States and its "vassal forces," denouncing a recent statement by Washington and allies against growing ties between Pyongyang and Moscow.
articles.title: North Korea says its alliance with Russia 'very effective,' no mention of troop losses

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Following are some of the key quotes from Russian President Vladimir Putin's annual phone-in and news conference.
articles.title: Highlights from Putin's annual news conference
